greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Table read by rows: the n-th row is the list of numbers diagonally up and to the left of n in the natural numbers read by antidiagonals.
link: Peter Kagey, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
mathematica: nn = 58; t = Table[(n^2 - n)/2 + Accumulate@ Range[n - 1, Ceiling[(Sqrt[9 + 8 nn] - 3)/2]] + 1, {n, Ceiling[(Sqrt[9 + 8 nn] - 3)/2] + 1}]; Table[Rest@ Map[t[[#1, #2]] & @@ # &, Most@ NestWhileList[# - 1 &, #, ! MemberQ[#, 0] &]] &@ First@ Position[t, n], {n, nn}] // Flatten (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Jun 29 2016 *)
results.author: _Peter Kagey_, Jun 08 2016
